attributes.action: apologize publicly in the Millennium Dome for the Iraq war
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background: Iraq was an immense error which has brought harm to our country and terrible suffering to the people of Iraq. It was the worst decision by any British postwar government, combining the lowest level of competence and foresight, the lowest level of truth and the lowest level of responsibility - for Tony Blair has never once acknowledged the consequences of his decisions. A public apology would allow him to depart with some measure of honour. If performed where suggested, it would fill the Millennium Dome for the only time in its life.
